title: Add dedicated Clans section with lore and sigil images

requirements.summary: Implement a new standalone Clans section (id="clans") with the required header, intro paragraph, and seven clan lore entries with verbatim descriptions.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section exists in the main page markup with id="clans" and a header reading "Clans".
The section includes the intro text: "Each clan wields unique elemental powers passed down through generations. Discover their strengths, their legends, and their role in the coming war."
The section renders seven clan blocks titled: Moon Clan, Sun Clan, Fire Clan, Water Clan, Lightning Clan, Earth Clan, Balance Clan.
Each clan block displays the exact corresponding description text from the user request (verbatim, including punctuation).

file_operations.description: Create a new React section component rendering a <section id="clans"> with a visible "Clans" header (compose the existing SectionHeader component), the required intro paragraph, and seven clan entry blocks (Moon/Sun/Fire/Water/Lightning/Earth/Balance) containing the exact descriptions from the user request (verbatim). Ensure layout is responsive (e.g., stacked on mobile, multi-column on larger screens) and readable.

requirements.summary: Wire the Clans section into the main page flow in App.tsx as a top-level sibling section (not inside Worldbuilding).
acceptanceCriteria: The Clans section is rendered as a sibling section alongside the other top-level sections in App.tsx.
The existing Worldbuilding section remains present and continues to render as before.

file_operations.description: Import and render the new ClansSection as its own top-level section in the <main> flow (as a sibling to existing sections), ensuring WorldbuildingSection remains unchanged and still renders as before.

requirements.summary: Add a Clans link to the top navigation that smooth-scrolls to id="clans" and closes the mobile menu after selection.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Clans" scrolls to the section with id="clans" with the same offset behavior as other links.
Mobile menu closes after selecting "Clans" (matching existing behavior).

file_operations.description: Update the navLinks list to include a new { label: 'Clans', id: 'clans' } item (on both desktop and mobile menus). Keep the existing smooth-scroll + offset behavior consistent with other links and ensure selecting it closes the mobile menu (maintaining current behavior).

requirements.summary: Render a sigil image for each clan entry using generated static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated with appropriate alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: Each of the seven clan entries displays a sigil image loaded from /assets/generated/*.png.
Each sigil image includes non-empty alt text matching the pattern "<Clan Name> sigil" (e.g., "Balance Clan sigil").
The Clans section layout remains readable and responsive from mobile to desktop (no overflow or broken grid).
